Wed., Nov. 8: We will discuss challenges in policies related to immigration, LGBTQ, police and criminal justice reform and access to the ballot for all Americans.

Dear ##first_name[ACLU Supporter]##,

Join us on Wednesday, November 8 for a discussion on civil rights in the Trump Era featuring Director of Communications and Public Policy Edwin C. Yohnka at the Normal Public Library. Yohnka will discuss the challenges presented by the Trump Administration in policies related to immigration, the treatment of those who are LGBTQ, police and criminal justice reform and access to the ballot for all Americans.

Edwin Yohnka, Director of Communications and Public Policy, addresses "Civil Liberties in the Trump Era"
Wednesday, November 8, 7 p.m.
Normal Public Library
Community Room
206 W College Ave.
Normal, IL 61761

The event is sponsored by the Central Illinois Chapter of the ACLU and the League of Women Voters of McLean County. All are welcome to attend.

If you can't make this event, or would like to hear even more from the ACLU staff – please join me on Wednesday, November 29 for our Listening Tour at the Chateau Bloomington Hotel. Follow us on Facebook and Twitter for the latest updates on our fight for civil liberties.

We hope to see you this weekend!

Colleen K. Connell
Executive Director
ACLU of Illinois
